intro: Antidesma barbatum, commonly known as the African satinwood, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are often hairy on the underside. The plant produces small, greenish flowers arranged in clusters, followed by red or orange berries that are attractive to birds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal forests and secondary growth areas. Due to its ornamental value and traditional uses, it is sometimes cultivated in horticulture.
